com.cage.colorharmony
Class ColorConvertor

java.lang.Object
  com.cage.colorharmony.ColorConvertor
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColorHarmony
public class ColorConvertor
extends java.lang.Object

ColorConvertor class

A helper class for the ColorHarmony class. Takes care of all kinds of conversions.

Author: Rolf van Gelder | CAGE Web Design
http://cagewebdev.com/colorharmony-processing-library/
info@cagewebdev.com

 java.lang.String Decimal2Hex(int decimal)
          Convert a decimal integer value to a hexadecimal string
Example: String hexValue = colorHarmony.Decimal2Hex(255);
Result: "FF"
 int Hex2Decimal(java.lang.String hex)
          Convert a hexadecimal string to a decimal integer value
Example: int decValue = colorHarmony.Hex2Decimal("FF");
Result: 255
 float[] Hex2HSL(java.lang.String hex)
          Convert a hexadecimal color string to HSL values
Example: float[] hsl = colorHarmony.Hex2HSL("FFFFFF");
Result: (0.0, 0.0, 100.0)
Note: the hex color string has to be 6 characters long!
 int Hex2P5(java.lang.String hex)
          Convert a hexadecimal color string to a Processing color (int)
Example: color P5color = colorHarmony.Hex2P5("FFFFFF");
Result: -1 (= color(255, 255, 255))
Note: the hex color string has to be 6 characters long!

Hex2HSL

public float[] Hex2HSL(java.lang.String hex)
Convert a hexadecimal color string to HSL values
Example: float[] hsl = colorHarmony.Hex2HSL("FFFFFF");
Result: (0.0, 0.0, 100.0)
Note: the hex color string has to be 6 characters long!

Parameters:
hex - Hexadecimal color string (6 characters)
Returns:
float[3] array with h, s and l values

HSL2Hex

public java.lang.String HSL2Hex(float h,
                                float s,
                                float l)
Convert HSL values to a hexadecimal solor string
Example: String hexValue = colorHarmony.HSL2Hex(0.0, 0.0, 100.0);
Result: "FFFFFF"

Parameters:
h - Hue value (0..360)
s - Saturation value (0..100)
l - Luminosity value (0..100)
Returns:
Hexadecimal color string (6 characters)

HSL2RGB

public int[] HSL2RGB(float h,
                     float s,
                     float l)
Convert HSL color values to RGB values
Example: int[] rgb = colorHarmony.HSL2RGB(0.0, 0.0, 100.0);
Result: (255, 255, 255)

Parameters:
h - Hue value (0..360)
s - Saturation value (0..100)
l - Luminosity value (also called lightness) (0..100)
Returns:
int[3] array with r, g and b values
